name: PETROLINK
description: PetroLink is BP Australia's Distributor ERP System (Distributor Business System). It is a comprehensive business administration system, which allows to instantly access the current days prices, stock information, order processing, debtor maintenance, general ledger interface, retail processing and to maintain customer details. Key functionalities of PetroLink are: Order processing and trips, stock management, debtors, sales and invoicing, taxation, interface satellite systems.PetroLink is linked to BP ISP(AU) instances (via PLI) and accepts daily downloads of BP-related reference data (customers, products, prices, etc) and returns details of captive sales and stock-affecting transactions.  It is also linked to BP JDE (AU) - also via PLI  -and accepts addresses (BillTo and ShipTo) and returns captive sales.In addition PetroLink accepts card transactions from both BASE24 and Card Plus.

name: PLI interfaces

PLI receives data from these BP apps, processes, propagates and transmits to Petro Link (/GXS -> non-PetroLink distributor ERP) as well as collects distributor originated information from PetroLink, processes and transmits back to above mentioned disparate systems. The data includes Lubes Order, Fuels and Lubes Customer details with their associated delivery addresses, Fuel Prices, Card transactions, Site Mapping and Post Event Sales Transactions. PLIMS is the front end GUI used for setting up various static data in PLI like distributors, stock points, product/pack, BP Plus locations/accounts, etc.

name: Credman Fleet (TR)
description:
Definition of the work:  
'CredMAN Fleet' application development and support technical issues are given in detail below, which will ensure on-line and daily credit control and management for BP Turkey Ta_ıtmatik Fleet customers;

– This application is considered to run in connection and interaction with ERP (ISPS and SAPFi) applications and Ta_ıtmatik (CM – Centromat) applications which are already used by BP Turkey. The Credit DD Files to be received from different banks within the day should be designed to receive information. 
– These proceedings will be performed automatically every morning and credit limit is sent to CM application.  It follows credit status of CM Customers on the basis of fleet. By means of restore to be performed every hour, the details of the customers whose credits have been consumed and whose fuel purchase has been stopped automatically will be displayed on CredMAN Fleet screens to be developed in the scope of OTP. The required actions will be taken in the scope of application flow and the latest credit positions of the customers for whom fuel purchase has been opened will be sent to CM application again. 

Technical Platform:
– CredMAN Fleet application and database runs over BP1XEUAP2766 and BP1XEUAP2765 servers in EMDC.

Data transmission interface and topology:  
– ISP (readonly)
– SAP (readonly)
– Centromat  (read & write)

name: Fuel Insights App (FIA)

The Fuel Insights App (FIA) provides a common operating model and a series of workflows supporting activities relating to fuel movement. These include: self-serve analytics, grade out analysis, scheduling helper, automated alerting & alert management, automated reporting, terminal downtime modelling, performance monitoring, management reporting and a Retail Territory Manager (RTM) view. The app will be developed within the Palantir 'Foundry' Platform

The Fuel Insights Application is built as a ‘Workshop’ application in Palantir’s Foundry Platform with a ‘Carbon’ landing page. Data surfaced in the application is sourced from bp’s WinDMS, SAP & Static Input which are modelled in bp’s AWS DataHub. The pipelines in bp’s AWS DataHub are maintained by DCM dataWorx, the front end application in Foundry is maintained by the Enterprise Big Data (EBD) Team.

name: SAP BW - WRM Production
description:
WRM is the old R&M FVC business warehouse system established in 2006 for the Turkish FVC business. This was subsequently deployed to Iberia, Germany (Fiege), ANZ and the Global Manufacturing MI in Spain and the Netherlands. As part of the Rhine 3a implementation in 2014, it has been rolled out to Germany, Austria and Luxembourg. Moreover, GSD has introduced the Retail functionality (Point of Sales Data Management POS/DM) into WRM which has increased the importance of the application. GSD has been rolled out to Belgium, Netherlands, Poland in 2016, followed by Switzerland, AirBP and Mexico till 2019.

WRM uses Near-Line Storage solution to archive older data out to cheaper storage and BIA (Business Intelligence Accelerator) to support heavy calculations, thus accelerates the runtime of the reports.

As it stands, 60% of WRM has been migrated to WRE, the new solution operating on Amazon (AWS) cloud and using SAP BW/4HANA with advanced in-memory computing technology. Remaining data flows along with POSDM are planned to be migrated by the end of 2020.

WRM is planned to be decommissioned by Q2 2022.

name: DNA RECREC
description:
This application is used for managing information on Receipts, Loads and Stocks
This information is stored for around 20 locations and their tanks.

The functionality that RecRec supplies above ISP is the conversion of vertical 'dip' measurements to volumes.  This is done by using the tank calibration tables loaded against each tank.  From these, using fixed equations, RecRec can convert a linear difference into a volume difference which can then be transferred to ISP.

name: DUTY DEFERMENT
description: The Duty Deferment application is used to create a spreadsheet which details the in and out movements of product on a daily basis at the Hamble Terminal. The losses (difference between physical stock (measured by dips) and the calculated stock) are calculated and are distributed between all the companies existing at that site. Also a Duty liability incurred when using Under Bond (UB) stocks for Duty Paid stock is calculated. This occurs when there is no Duty Paid stock at a location and product is taken out of Under Bond stock. Obviously there is a tax liability owing to HMCE when this occurs. The application also creates movements on ISP for these Loss/Gains and Duty Liabilities.

name: OnBase - Spain/ Portugal related only
description:
OnBase - WebBased application to access documents  from the archive service of Iron Mountain (formerly Recall)

The Iron Mountain Service is managed and contract with the local Logsitic Business in Spain/ Portugal.

This Application Package is to Spain/ Portugal related only. The related OPS Team has no insight or contacts available for any other global engagements.

Load authorization number (LAN) is the physical loading document provided by Fuels Terminals in Spain to all hauliers.  It contains all details about truck loadings . After discharge in destination, the customer sign the physical loading document (LAN) to the hauliers. This document will be necessary in case of incidents (transport, discharge, etc) and also for tax or fiscal purposes even tax audits and inspection processes. That means LAN has to be stored during minimum period of five years.  Iron Mountain is providing a scanning service of the paper and provides electronic access via a Web Application called 'OnBase', This application was originated by a company ' Recall Holdings Limited' which had been acquisitioned by Iron Mountain in 2016.
